questionList.questionStatement: Which of the following steps in the scientific method comes following observation?
The main component of the plant cell wall is _______________?
Which of the following classes of enzymes digests carbohydrates?
Which of the following kingdoms of life is consisting of prokaryotic organisms?
Which component of soil fertility is improved when farmers grow legumes in crop rotation?
Before making crosses, which part of the flower did Mendel remove to avoid self pollination?
Which one of the following do bees use to inform other bees about the location and distance of a new source of nectar they discover?
One of the following molecules is the building units of an enzyme molecule.
Which one of the following is the main constituent of biological membranes?
One of the following biomes in Africa is supporting large wild mammals such as elephants, giraffes and lions.
questionList.choiceB: The Rain Forest of Western Ethiopia

questionList.questionStatement: Which of the following is the correct F<sub>2</sub> phenotypic ratio of a monohybrid cross?
How many carbon atoms are there in one disaccharide molecule?
Which unit is best to use for measuring the smallest cells and organelles?
Which energy rich organic compound contains adenine in its molecule?
What are the most frequent causative agents of food poisoning?
What are the most likely causes of variations within species?
In which hominid species did scientists find the smallest brain size(cranial capacity)?
Which of the following is NOT classified as a learned behaviour?
What is the specialist in biology called if he/she studies fossils to generate new knowledge on the origin and evolution of living things of past geologic periods?
All proteins contain carbon, hydrogen, oxygen and what other element?
What makes unsaturated fatty acids different from saturated fatty acids?
questionList.choiceA: The presence of long chain of carbon.
questionList.choiceB: The presence of one or more double bonds.
questionList.choiceC: The presence of large number of hydrogen atoms.
questionList.choiceD: Their occurrence as solid at room temperature.

questionList.questionStatement: Which of the following pairs of molecules are known to have catalytic activity?
If a suspension of a mixture of cellular organelles is spun in a centrifuge, which organelle settles to the bottom first?
During chemiosmosis, what substance diffuses from one side to the other side of the membrane?
Which of the following human diseases can be prevented by taking proper diets?
When two species are compared, which of the following sources of evidence is least informative about the degree of relationships between the species?
Which of the following practices does NOT normally transmit HIV?
What is the important role played by microorganisms such as bacteria and fungi in the ecosystem?
In which one of the following aspects is the tropical rainforest biome poor?
If the size of a cell increases, which one of the following gets smaller?
questionList.choiceB: The surface area of the cell
questionList.choiceC: Surface area to volume ratio of the cell
questionList.choiceD: Volume to surface area ratio of the cell

questionList.questionStatement: Which of the following is NOT usually true as an ecological succession progresses to advanced seral stages?
questionList.choiceC: The depth of the soil increases

questionList.questionStatement: One of the following is an important cause of gene mutation.
What is the reproductive isolating mechanism called if two species of frogs do not interbreed because they cannot understand the mating calls of one another?
How many chromosomes do humans inherit from each of their parents?
In which one of the four phases of population growth is the number of the population the highest?
Which of the following is NOT true about the gene called SRY?
questionList.choiceA: It is found on the Y-chromosome.
questionList.choiceD: Females have two copies of this gene.

questionList.questionStatement: To which of the following groups do those bacteriophages that integrate their DNA into the chromosome of their bacterial host belong?
What do we call the learned behaviour if a mouse that had just escaped from the mouth of a cat jumped violently at a slight touch by a trivial object?
Which of the following theories explains evolutionary changes of living things in terms of changes in their allele frequencies?
Which of the following is an important function of the Golgi apparatus?
questionList.choiceB: Packaging of proteins for export out of the cell
questionList.choiceD: Storage of waste materials not needed by the cell

questionList.questionStatement: Which of the following field equipment is used to determine an exact location of a place?
The sheep 'dolly' is an example of which biotechnological manipulation of animals by human?
Among the following, which one is the best criterion to show that two populations belong to same species?
In the process of the evolution of life on earth, which of the following four processes evolved last?
What is a theory in biology?
questionList.choiceB: A proof that shows the hypothesis is true
questionList.choiceC: A hypothesis supported by experiments and/or observations
questionList.choiceD: An opinion or educated guess resulting from observations

questionList.questionStatement: For which of the following is a theodolite used in biology education?
questionList.choiceB: Recording positions where a species is found.
questionList.choiceC: Measuring the rate of flow of water in a cell.
questionList.choiceD: Measuring the pH of water or soil.

questionList.questionStatement: What is the name of the sugar found in milk?
To which class of enzymes do the digestive enzymes belong?
In which of the following features are eukaryotic cells distinguished from prokaryotic cells?
What will happen if human red blood cells are kept in a hypotonic solution?
questionList.choiceA: Lose water by osmosis and burst.
questionList.choiceB: Lose water by osmosis and shrink.
questionList.choiceC: Take in water by osmosis, swell and burst.
questionList.choiceD: Take in water by osmosis, swell and remain turgid.

questionList.questionStatement: In which type of solution is the water potential more negative than in the cells?
Which of the following paired organelles are membrane-bound?
Most cell membranes are primarily composed of which compounds?
Which group of micro-organisms causes the disease known as athlete's foot?
Choose the one that is different from all the others.
Under which of the following groups can the fungi be more conveniently placed?
What is the type of community called when it has reached the final and most complex stage of a succession?
Which of the following is an ecosystem?
questionList.choiceC: All the organisms in a given area
questionList.choiceD: The non-living components of an environment

questionList.questionStatement: Which of the following crops is considered to be the best choice for a better balance of essential amino acids as a human diet?
What is the main reason for the high species richness of plants and mammals observed in Ethiopia?
questionList.choiceC: Presence of several biomes within the country
questionList.choiceD: Effcient management of the ecological resources

questionList.questionStatement: In which of the following are flowers and fruits found?
In a cross between heterozygotes what proportion is expected to be homozygous recessive?
Gene silencing is the function of one of the following molecules.
Which process is held responsible for chronic myelogenous leukemia?
Two parents of genotype Aa are cross-bred. The alleles show complete dominance. What proportion of the offspring will phenotypioally look like their parents?
Which one of the following concepts contains all the others?
Choose the one that is NOT a requirement of all living things.
What is the advantage of using HAART (highly active anti- retroviral therapy) for the treatment of HIV?
questionList.choiceA: It gives a lasting immunity to HIV,
questionList.choiceD: It helps to break the life cycle of HIV.

questionList.questionStatement: Which of the following characteristics can show the evolutionary relationships among organisms?
The group of the Ethiopian wolf which does NOT contribute to territory marking with their urine containing pheromones is
What can one conclude about the contents of the foodstuff if a mixture of Benedict solution and a foodstuff remain blue after heating?
Which of the following types of enzyme inhibitions can be removed when the end product of the metabolic pathway is depleted?
If red blood cells shrink when placed in a certain solution, what is the strength of the solution relative to the strength of the protoplasm of the cells?
Which of the following is NOT true about photosystem-II?
questionList.choiceA: Its reaction center molecule is P680.
questionList.choiceB: It passes its excited electrons to Photosystem-I.
questionList.choiceC: The energy lost from its excited electrons reduces NADP.
questionList.choiceD: It replenishes its lost electrons from photolysis of water.

questionList.questionStatement: On which one of the following principles are most of the anti-HIV drugs currently in use working?
Among the following mating, where the ABO blood genotypes of the partners are shown, identify the mating in which all the children will have the same blood type.
If a new mutant allele arises in a certain population, which of the following factors determines if the allele is going to be adaptive or non-adaptive?
questionList.choiceA: The environment in which the population lives.
questionList.choiceB: The rate at which the gene mutates.
questionList.choiceC: The population in which the gene is found.
questionList.choiceD: The use and disuse of the gene by the population.

questionList.questionStatement: Which of the following is the correct route that connects a stimulus and a response?
Which of the following contents RNA differs from DNA?
Which of the following cell types can be rich in lysosomes?
What is the importance of chemiosmosis in photosynthesis and cellular respiration?
If the age pyramid of a certain country is narrowing at the base, what does this tell about the trend of the population size of the country? The population size is:
Suppose the amino acid coding region in a mRNA is 1200 nucleotides long, how long is the protein in terms of amino acid number?
If a new anti-HIV drug is to be developed to prevent the virus from entering the host cell, which one of the following processes should the drug target?
questionList.choiceC: Integration of viral DNA into host DNA
questionList.choiceD: Assembly of viral parts into a whole Virus

questionList.questionStatement: Which one of the following factors is NOT important for evolutionary change of a population?
questionList.choiceD: Survival of all that are born

questionList.questionStatement: One of the following would be harder to see under the ordinary light microscope that is more likely to be available in school laboratories.
In some human liver cells there are 92 chromosomes per cell. What is the ploidy level of such cells?
Which of the following groups of substances are all inorganic?
questionList.choiceD: Carbon dioxide, amino acid, fatty acid

questionList.questionStatement: In which of the following compounds are both members of the pair are polymers Of carbohydrates that naturally occur in plants only?
Which of the following is generally expected to give better health benefits when present in human diet?
Where does the light dependent reaction of photosynthesis occur in the chloroplast?
questionList.choiceB: In the fluid of the stroma
questionList.choiceC: In all parts of the chloroplast

questionList.questionStatement: For which of the following is the sugar produced by photosynthesis NOT used?
In which process is ATP generated during short distance high speed running?
Which one of the following choices shows the end products of a mitotic cell division?
What exactly happens during a substitution mutation?
questionList.choiceA: One base is replaced by a different base.
questionList.choiceB: An extra base is added during DNA replication.
questionList.choiceC: A base is missed out during DNA replication.
questionList.choiceD: Changes occur in the arrangement or structure of a chromosome.

questionList.questionStatement: During the course of evolution, which of the following events came before all the others?
questionList.choiceA: Origin of dinosaurs and other reptiles.
questionList.choiceB: Availability of free oxygen in the atmosphere.
questionList.choiceC: Origin of the oldest eukaryotic organisms.
questionList.choiceD: Origin of the first multicellular animals and plants.

questionList.questionStatement: What kind of natural selection is at work in a situation where individuals at both extreme ends of the range get better survival advantages than those around the middle?
In which geologic period does the fossil record show more diverse and relatively higher forms of organisms?
To what kind of animal behaviour can the spinning of a web by a spider be classified?
Which of the following is a recently developed active area of research in biology today?
